title: Buggy and Shanks Were Roger Pirates Together
summary: Based on Buggy's intense grudge against Shanks revealed in Episode 7, fans theorized early on that they have a shared history, possibly as former crewmates.
fullText: When Buggy reacts so strongly to Shanks' name in Episode 7, cursing him and showing deep anger, it hints at a complex shared history. Early fans theorized that Buggy and Shanks must have been close at some point, possibly serving on the same crew, which would explain the intensity of Buggy's grudge. This theory was later confirmed when it was revealed they both served on Gol D. Roger's crew as apprentices.
author: Early One Piece Fans

source.title: Buggy Character Page - One Piece Wiki

title: Zoro's Oni Giri Technique Connects to Demon Mythology
summary: Fans theorize that Zoro's Oni Giri (Demon Slash) technique and his general connection to demon imagery foreshadows deeper connections to demonic or Asura-related powers.
fullText: The debut of Zoro's Oni Giri technique in Episode 7, with its demon-themed name, sparked early theories about Zoro having deeper connections to demon or Asura mythology. Fans noted the deliberate choice of 'Oni' (demon) in the technique's name and theorized this was foreshadowing for Zoro's future abilities. This was later validated when Zoro manifested his Asura form.
author: One Piece Theory Community

source.title: Three Sword Style - One Piece Wiki

title: The Straw Hat is a Joy Boy Relic
summary: Episode 7's emphasis on the straw hat's importance to Luffy, when Buggy damages it, led to theories that the hat itself is an ancient relic with historical significance beyond just being Shanks' gift.
fullText: When Luffy becomes enraged after Buggy damages his straw hat in Episode 7, calling it his 'treasure,' it reinforced theories that the hat is more than just a memento from Shanks. Fans theorized the straw hat might be connected to Joy Boy, the ancient figure from the Void Century, or contain some hidden power or significance that will be revealed as a major plot point. The repeated emphasis on the hat's importance from Episode 1 onward suggested it would play a crucial role in the endgame.
author: Reddit: r/OnePiece Theory Community
